posts.cooked:
Hi!

It would be great if sender and receiver could have the ability to mark media as NSFW. It would be useful when someone sends you something sensitive and you don’t want people around you seeing it. When you get a notification and click it, the conversation shows up and you don’t know it what the sender has sent is ok for others to get a glimpse of.

I suggest adding a little icon in one of the corners of the preview and when this icon is clicked the image is shown
My suggestion is that media marked as NSFW should appear blurred until it is touched and then the image/video is shown. The user can then click it again to blur it, e.g how NSFW content is handed in Reddit

link_counts.title: Toggle display of any & all images & videos
Q&A with the Community Moderation Team
Mark specific words in messages as spoiler

posts.cooked: As a workaround, you can make media not immediately visible by using view-once media. Unfortunately, as the name implies, the media can only be viewed once, so it may not be ideal.

posts.name: Johanw666
posts.cooked: If such an option would be added I would suggest giving it a more neutral name, like confidential media. NSFW is a term we usually link to the prudish American culture who blurr nipples and reproductive organs, and beep-out swear words spoken on TV.
absolutely agree. I just couldn’t think of a better description at the time, but confidential media is absolutely better

posts.name: alex@lavabit.top
posts.cooked: No. For the love of God, no.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked: In the new group system groups you joined are considered trusted and thus media are auto downloaded. It would indeed be nice if media do get auto downloaded, but remain blurred if confidential / nsfw. This would be a good alternative to self-destructing media, because sometimes you don’t want something to disappear over time, but your only concern is shoulder surfing.
I think this could also be bundled in with the markdown. I use Reddit and like the spoiler option there, as well as the others like strikethrough and code.

posts.name: Caleb Jasik
posts.cooked:
A great example of prior art is Discord’s spoiler tags:
https://support.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/360022320632-Spoiler-Tags-

||this content is hidden until you click on it||

using double pipes will hide a message, including photos and videos!

There’s also a setting to globally show all spoiler tags, which some people might want.

I definitely think “spoiler” is more general purpose, for example people use it when talking about cybersecurity capture the flag solves, so that you don’t accidentally see a solution unless you want to, or for talking about tv show spoilers!

I would really love to see this as a feature!

posts.name: Brind On
posts.cooked: “Content label” or “content warning” (mastodon) two more option

Oh that’s a cool Idea -
I would love a different type of design.
In general signal should support the basic markup function like Bold, Italic etc. - i think there is already a different feature request for that.
But now my point:
I would include a custom markup e.g.
//Sensetiveinfo// and this text between the markup will be Blurred or displayed like a password.

If you touch or type on this part of the message it will be revealed for a short amount of time. To see it again you have to type again.

Like this you can write a normal message, but hide specific parts for people siting around you.

posts.name: Bells Craig
posts.cooked:
I would love it to be like spoiler but maybe Conf for confidential…

But it could be a box that somebody clicks before they send and then it just hides the message one layer deeper…
So that when somebody opens the message it asks them something like “confidential. Safe to open?”

Related:

Font styling for Signal messages Feature Requests
Spoiler formatting has been added, behind a feature flag. [image] [image]

Also see my post with the video from Twitter:

Font styling for Signal messages Feature Requests
I found this on Twitter, from 25 Jan: And a video from 5 April:

We now have formatting and spoiler support for text which is great.

Could this be extended so we can mark pictures and videos as spoilers? That would also solve this topic.

posts.name: Drilmo
posts.cooked:
Yeah it’s could be cool to do the same with picture and video (with capacity to save and share the media, not like “view once” feature) .

And maybe simplify the user experience, it’s long to have to select the text then click on formatting then select blurring and those for each message during a certain topic of conversation

I just want to add that Telegram has already implemented this feature for images. When sending an image you can click the three dots on the top right and select to send as spoiler. Here’s the image of an oddly shaped cucumber for illustration purposes.

image814×632 63 KB

posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked:
There is something quite amusing about an unencrypted (by default) messenger with a sensitive cover feature.

I still join the chorus in favor of Signal adding this type of feature, though I think a simple thick enough blur cover for images/videos is better than uh… that.
Preferably a stronger blur, with a center icon that makes it clear it’s a blurred image.

Screenshot_20241124-1556561080×1846 88 KB

I really love how Tusky implements it.

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked: Requires an extra click. If this is implemented please also add a setting to ignore it and just show it. Saves me the trouble of adding it to my fork.
